instructions: Try steps 1-3, and 7, from the iPhone section of this article. Update the version of the macOS running on your Mac . Just like with the iPhone and iTunes, running old software could cause the AirPlay icon to disappear. Check your Mac's firewall settings . The firewall software built into your Mac protects it from attack by blocking unknown attempts to connect to your computer. That's great, but sometimes it can also block useful things like AirPlay, too. Try changing your firewall settings in Settings > Security & Privacy > Firewall > Firewall Options . Check the box next to Automatically allow signed software to receive incoming connections . Enable AirPlay Mirroring in the menu bar . You can make it easier to find the AirPlay icon by adding it to the menubar in the top right corner of the screen. To do this, go to Settings > Displays > check the box next to Show mirroring options in the menu bar when available . With that checked, whenever there are AirPlay devices you can connect to, the AirPlay icon will appear in your menu bar. Just click it and select a device to connect to.
